intro: Staurogyne kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon waterweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Staurogyne kamerunensis plays a role in providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates and fish. Its morphology is adapted to thrive in low-light conditions, making it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
